required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Novel Approach for Transjugular Intrahepatic Portocaval Shunt Creation Using Real-time Three Dimensional Roadmap
clinical_study.official_title: A Novel Approach for Transjugular Intrahepatic Portocaval Shunt Creation Using Real-time Three Dimensional Roadmap

brief_summary.textblock: TIPS creation has been widely used to treat the complications associated with portal hypertension. In association with increased operator experience and the ongoing development of imaging modalities, the rate of major complications associated with TIPS has decreased significantly in the past decades. However, the passage of a curved needle from the hepatic vein into the portal vein still remains a challenging and time-consuming part of the procedure and is associated with puncture-related complications that are potentially fatal.Three-dimensional roadmap guidance has been widely applied in various interventions. The aim of the present study is to prospectively assess the feasibility and efficacy of real-time 3D roadmap guidance during TIPS creation.

primary_outcome.description: number of patients who have received TIPS creation technically successfully
number of intrahepatic punctures for TIPS creation

secondary_outcome.measure: radiographic fluoroscopy time for portal vein entry
secondary_outcome.description: duration of radiographic fluoroscopy for portal vein entry

secondary_outcome.measure: radiographic fluoroscopy time for the whole procedure
secondary_outcome.description: duration of radiographic fluoroscopy for the whole procedure

arm_group.description: TIPS was established using 3d roadmap guidance
conventional TIPS procedure using wedged hepatic venography

intervention.description: conventional TIPS procedure using wedged hepatic venography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
cirrhosis complications of portal hypertension requiring TIPS
Exclusion Criteria:
non-cirrhotic portal hypertension complete occlusion of intrahepatic portal vein gastro-renal shunt presence of liver tumor pregnancy other contradictions of TIPS
